title.narrative: Preparedness and Early Response to Public Health Emergencies in Konso and South Omo, Ethiopia. NMA

description.narrative: The project will work on prediction, prevention, detection and response to health emergencies in the target areas. The proposed project will aim to scale-up provision of early warning information for malaria to the project areas, in addition to adopting various approaches and mechanisms of climate information dissemination. The proposed project will also support to undertake research on other climate sensitive diseases, develop climate thresholds, and using these thresholds, NMA and MoH will start to co-develop and disseminate health meteorology advisories. Conduct an assessment/research to understand factors that support and constrain the use of climate information to early detect and respond to health emergencies. Co-development of health meteorological service for health emergency preparedness (design modelling of thresholds, coordination, designing protocol) Conduct training for health extension workers, development agents on health-met information application

Up on the completion, the project anticipates the following significant change: Improved public health surveillance and health-meteorology system, Health institution’s structures become functional to respond to and anticipate health hazards and Improved Healthy behaviour among the communities on how to maintain a healthy environment to prevent communicable diseases.
